creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: bearded man sitting on a seat with windblown cape holding a baby upside down by its leg in PL hand, and a sickle in PR hand, two dragons appear to be pulling him; clouds divide that scene from a farming scene below: man at  L plows field near a barn and man at R slaughters a boar
marks:
Signature, Title, Label

inscribed in plate, upp monogram in plate, at top: [VS] 
titled in plate,
provenance: [Christopher Mendez, London; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Saturn
